Pre-Game Insights: India has already defeated Pakistan in the Super 12 match, by four wickets on 23 October.
England's Captain Jos Buttler and Alex Hales have been the source of most of the runs for the team, as both have hit a fifty each.
India's opening batsmen KL Rahul, Virat Kohli, Suryakumar Yadav are in form, while key bowlers Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Arshdeep Singh and Mohd Shami do look to manage any conditions.
England's bowling attack by pacers Mark Wood and Sam Curran can promise a tough start to Indian batters.
Miscellaneous Highlights: If India beats England on 10 November, it will be a dream World Cup final match between India and Pakistan, just like 2007.
The pitch in Adelaide Oval has been bouncy and good for batting, and the short square boundaries will tempt the hitters to go big.
The weather in Adelaide Oval will be partly cloudy on Thursday, with no chances of rain, there will be a full game without any disruption.
Others: India has played 22 matches with England in the T20 World Cup till now, out of which India won 12 and England 10.
The possible XIs for India and England are mentioned in the article.
